page.syntax: Sequence_Number as N = ArgumentNumber(Name as C)

argument.name: Sequence_Number
argument.description: The sequence number of an argument.

argument.name: Name
argument.description: The unique name property of a SQL::Argument object set with the SQL::Arguments::Add() or SQL::Arguments::Set() methods.

page.description: Get the sequence number of the named argument. Returns -1 if not found.
page.discussion: The ArgumentNumber() method returns the sequence number (subscript) of an argument.
page.example: dim args as SQL::Arguments ? args.add("city", "Boston") = .T. ? args.add("state", "MA") = .T. ? args.ArgumentNumber("state") = 2
